item.title: Simplified Definition of Hypothesis Testing
item.description: Definition 1 2 In science, a statistical hypothesis refers to an assumption about a population, and the statistical decision-making process of accepting or rejecting this hypothesis is called statistical hypothesis testing. This process involves two competing hypotheses, where the hypothesis that the researcher wishes to support is called the alternative hypothesis $H_{1}$, and the hypothesis accepted when there is no substantial evidence to claim that the alternative hypothesis is true

item.title: Rejection Region and Significance Level
item.description: Definition 1 The error of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is actually true is called a Type I error. The error of failing to reject the null hypothesis when the alternative hypothesis is true is called a Type II error. The maximum probability of committing a Type I error is called the Significance Level. The statistic used for hypothesis testing is called the Test Statistic. The region of the
